meanings.definition: Tending or able to stick to things
meanings.sent1: The candy was so sticky that it got stuck to my fingers.
meanings.sent2: The tape was sticky and held the papers together well.
meanings.sent3: I tried to shake off the sticky label, but it clung on stubbornly.
meanings.sent4: The humid weather made the air feel sticky and heavy.
meanings.sent5: The spider's web was sticky, trapping unsuspecting insects.

meanings.definition: Covered in a substance that sticks to things
meanings.sent1: The sticky syrup dripped down the sides of the pancake.
meanings.sent2: Her hands were sticky after eating the sweet cotton candy.
meanings.sent3: The sticky glue made it challenging to separate the pages.
meanings.sent4: The tree was covered in sticky sap, attracting curious insects.
meanings.sent5: The sticky jam coated the toast in a delicious layer.

meanings.definition: Difficult to deal with or escape from
meanings.sent1: The situation became sticky when they couldn't agree on a solution.
meanings.sent2: The conversation with her boss was sticky, and she felt nervous.
meanings.sent3: Trying to avoid the sticky topic only made it more awkward.
meanings.sent4: The sticky problem seemed to follow him wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The sticky dilemma required careful consideration and planning.
